Sentencas: Current methods used to manufacture solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) involve multiple steps, applying successive layers to produce laminated components associated with repeated sintering steps.
Titulo: The unification of paste rheologies for the co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This work aims to cut the number of processing steps involved by co-extruding a complete SOFC tube from pastes in a single step, which is then co-sintered.
Titulo: The unification of paste rheologies for the co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Several aspects must be overcome in order to co-extrude such a fuel cell.
Titulo: The unification of paste rheologies for the co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Crucially the co-extrusion process requires that the theological properties of the materials are well matched.
Titulo: The unification of paste rheologies for the co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This prevents the formation of flow defects and allows for the continuous operation of the co-extrusion process.
Titulo: The unification of paste rheologies for the co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This work has investigated the manipulation of the rheological parameters through design of the paste formulation as well as the manufacturing process.
Titulo: The unification of paste rheologies for the co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Two pastes, one made from a fine yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) and the other from a combination of a fine YSZ, a coarser nickel oxide and activated carbon, have been characterised using the Benbow/Bridgwater model and their parameters have been unified through adjustment of their solids loading.
Titulo: The unification of paste rheologies for the co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Using packing theory and the assumption that pastes will only flow when the powder void space has been filled with a slight excess of liquid to overcome inter-particulate friction, an intermediate paste has been designed to possess similar rheological properties.
Titulo: The unification of paste rheologies for the co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells
